description: Change of use from single family dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to residential care home (Use Class C2); facilitated by single storey side/rear extension; external alterations to rear elevation; and formation of vehicle crossover
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled: ''PROPOSED FLOOR PLANS' (includes partitioned laundry facility and revised staff facilities layout), 'EXISTING ELEVATIONS', 'EXISTING FLOOR PLANS', 'PROPOSED ELEVATIONS' (includes proposed extension and external alterations), received via email: 27.12.2018
drawing titled: 'BLOCK PLAN' (showing proposed 3.5m wide vehicle crossover), received via email: 21.02.2019.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of the residential care units hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.16 of the London Plan (2016). | The site shall be used as a children's residential care home only (C2 use class) and shall be used for no other purposes, including any other C2 use or any other uses in the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain control over the nature of the use, in the interests of restricting the uses of the building to those which are compatible with the site and area, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality all in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 3B and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.14, 3.16, 3.17 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | The number of children accommodated at the site shall not exceed a maximum of five at any time.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 6.13 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.10, 6.13 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | The number of staff at the site shall not exceed a maximum of four staff between the hours of 07:00 and 22:00 (day shift) and a maximum of one staff member between the hours of 22:00 and 07:00 (night shift).

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality, and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 4.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 6.13 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.10, 6.13 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, pedestrian visibility splays should be provided at all times measuring 1.5m by 1.5m, with no obstruction more than 0.6m high for the vehicle access where it meets the back edge of the footway; these shall be established prior to the first use of the driveway for car parking, and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interest of highways safety in accordance with Policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016). | Secure and sheltered cycle storage for two cycle parking spaces (one for staff and one for residents) shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter in accordance with drawing titled: 'BLOCK PLAN' (showing proposed 3.5m wide vehicle crossover), received via email: 21.02.2019.
Reason: To ensure that the development provides a suitable level of cycle parking provision in the interests of sustainable transport, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016).
